definition: to grasp/to hold/to operate/to manage/to control/to steer/to exercise/to drill (practice)/to play/to speak (a language)

pinyin: Guo2 ji4 Ti3 cao1 Lian2 he2 hui4

sentences.english: Let`s go to watch the gymnastics competition.
I was 26 by then -- which is ancient for a male gymnast.
sentences.chinese: 我那時26歲，作爲一名男子體操運動員已經太老了。
1998年世界盃體操賽平衡木冠軍。

sentences.english: I often go to a gym for a workout.
When she was young she practiced gymnastics.
We went into the gym, and I just thought it was so cool.
sentences.chinese: 我們去了體操房，我覺得一切都很棒。

sentences.english: The new version will be just as boring, the young Mr. Hu said.
sentences.chinese: 年輕的胡元說，新廣播體操還是會一樣的單調。

sentences.english: Uneven bars is a traditional Superior event in women's artistic gymnastics in china.
sentences.chinese: 高低槓項目是我國女子競技體操的傳統優勢項目。

sentences.english: The paper provides the concrete method combining work to discuss.
sentences.chinese: 本文結合工作實踐，提出具體操作方法，與同行共榷。

sentences.english: After the 9th national games, the Chinese gymnastics team will prepare for the Athen Olympic Games.
sentences.chinese: 九運會後，中國體操隊將進入雅典奧運會備戰期。

sentences.english: Set a large gymnastics room allows you more opportunities to show self-perfection.
sentences.chinese: 大型的集體操房讓您更多的機會去展現完美的自我。

sentences.english: I'm not so sure if I want to join that gym.
sentences.chinese: 我不確定是否想上那個體操課。

sentences.english: My little sister loves gym, in fact, she is good at balance beam.
sentences.chinese: 我妹妹喜歡體操，事實上，她擅長平衡木。

sentences.english: Physical quality training is an important section of foundational eurythmics training.
sentences.chinese: 身體素質練習是藝術體操基礎訓練的重要部分。

sentences.english: Sightseeing and receiving of telephone call will be allowed outside the gymnastic room.
sentences.chinese: 請於本室室外參觀團體操課程或接聽手提電話。

sentences.english: And two years is exactly the age gap in question with the Chinese female gymnasts.
sentences.chinese: 而兩年剛好是中國女子體操隊隊員受到質疑的年齡差。

definition: to warm up (sports)/(fig.) to prepare/to get in condition
to fight, esp. with hands/wrestling (as a sport)/to wrestle/to wrestle (against fate, with a problem etc)/to capture prey
in one's spare time/outside working hours/amateur (historian etc)
